passage_text: The median home value in Washington is $489,800. Washington home values have gone up 5.9% over the past year and Zillow predicts they will rise 1.1% within the next year. The median rent price in Washington is $2,550, which is higher than the Washington Metro median of $2,025. Read more. Foreclosures will be a factor impacting home values in the next several years. In Washington 1.0 homes are foreclosed (per 10,000).

Washington Average Rent. As of August 2015, average apartment rent within 10 miles of Washington, DC is $2026. One bedroom apartments in Washington rent for $1771 a month on average and two bedroom apartment rents average $2284. See our listings of Washington Apartments.

As of August 2015, average apartment rent within 10 miles of Washington, DC is $2026. One bedroom apartments in Washington rent for $1771 a month on average and two bedroom apartment rents average $2284. See our listings of Washington Apartments.

The average apartment rent over the prior 6 months in Washington has increased by $145 (7.7%). One bedroom units have increased by $33 (1.9%) and two bedroom apartments have increased by $12 (0.5%). See our listings of Washington Apartments.

Spokane enjoys a lower cost of living than Seattle, making this a great city to explore houses for sale or apartments for rent. Average house price is $125,000, while the median price for apartment rentals is $530 per month.

Our cost of living indices are based on a US average of 100. An amount below 100 means Washington, Washington is cheaper than the US average. A cost of living index above 100 means Washington, Washington is more expensive. Overall, Washington, Washington cost of living is 117.30.
